CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Blackston, Schenley High School senior, 214 Elmore Sy., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?"  Answer reads: "If you can't get along and don't have your civil rights there should be some discussion to find out why. I think to use actual violence or physical force is wrong.  However, because this is America and we live under the Constitution, I think that militant legal force is all right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Blackston, wearing button down trench coat, v-neck sweater, and striped button down collared shirt, standing in front of light colored column,  pedestrians, building, and store window in background
